visualization_prompt: Generate a map chart showing geographical POI distribution using OpenStreetMap basemap integration
visualization_explanation: This visualization combines geographical context with point data using Highcharts' map module. The dataset contains two primary elements: 1) Basemap tiles from OpenStreetMap providing spatial reference (raster data), and 2) A single POI coordinate (vector data) with associated metadata. The synthetic POI data maintains geographical validity through WGS84 coordinates. The basemap serves as continuous spatial data while the POI represents discrete nominal data. The map chart was selected as it optimally presents geospatial relationships while maintaining Tufte's data-ink ratio through clean basemap integration. Cairo's perceptual principles are applied through contrasting marker colors (#ff4444 vs basemap grayscale) and proportional symbol sizing. Navigation controls (μ=13 zoom level) maintain legibility while allowing user exploration. Axis labels use Cairo's text legibility guidelines with 14px font size and high-contrast coloring (#666666 on light background).
